alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 25 at 1:22AM AKDT until March 27 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range near Passes. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...South winds are expected to increase this evening through passes, with snow developing on Sunday. Blowing snow will develop this evening as winds increase, with very low visibility developing on Sunday as falling snow develops. The worst conditions will be in passes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
